Strong earthquake strikes eastern Afghanistan, killing over 600 people
subhead: The magnitude 6.0 earthquake struck the area near the Pakistani border at night on Sunday, September 1, killing at least 800 people. At least five aftershocks, including one measured at magnitude 5.2, followed it.

title: Ukrainian forces turn to unmanned ground vehicles to counter drones
subhead: Specialized Ukrainian units using unmanned ground vehicles are emerging across all brigades. These machines already carry out most supply runs and evacuations on the front lines.
byline: By Emmanuel Grynszpan (Donetsk and Dnipropetrovsk regions (Ukraine), special correspondent)

title: Sylvain Amic, president of the Musée d'Orsay and the Musée de l'Orangerie, has died
subhead: Appointed in 2024, the curator viewed museums as places for sharing and made the circulation of artworks and access for younger generations his main priorities. He died on Sunday, August 31, at the age of 58.

title: Marcel Gauchet, historian and philosopher: 'Progressivism has locked itself into a denial of uncomfortable realities'
subhead: 'May '68 Thinkers Reflect On Trump Era' (2/6). The democracy specialist explains that we are witnessing a major ideological reversal after decades of depoliticization that have allowed neoliberal individualism and 'libertarian societal values' to triumph.

title: Lorde, New Zealand electropop sensation: 'With 'Virgin,' I wanted to document my femininity'
subhead: Twelve years ago, while still a teenager, the singer rose to fame with her hit song 'Royals.' Quickly endorsed by some of the biggest names in music, the 28-year-old's unique voice and bold songwriting were a departure from music industry standards. She has just released her raw fourth album, 'Virgin,' and will perform at the Zénith in Paris on November 10.

title: In Hawaii, the volcano's repentants: 'I see it as a metaphor for the misuse of our planet's resources'
subhead: 'Of Volcanoes and Men' (3/6). In Hawaii, there is a local belief that the goddess Pele brings misfortune to careless visitors who dare to take a piece of volcanic earth with them. To ward off this 'curse,' many return their stolen souvenirs along with a note of apology. Photographer Ryan Thompson compiled these testimonies of repentance.

title: Ten years after the migration crisis, Germany assesses Merkel's 'Wir schaffen das' legacy
subhead: 'We will manage,' Chancellor Angela Merkel declared on August 31, 2015, as hundreds of thousands of refugees, particularly from Syria, sought asylum in the country. Studies show her proactive integration policy yielded positive results, even though the issue remains divisive.
